content: around the entire hat until you have only 1 stitch left on the hat to slip_stitch into if you have 2 that s ok as you are working the headband it will look like this 4 hold the 2 edges of the brim together and slip_stitch up the edge to join fasten_off and weave in your ends 5 6 enjoy your messy bun hat alternate ending because sometimes we just need alternatives after making quite a few of these i decided i wanted a quicker brim i love love the look of the single_crochet brim but that is a lot of single crochets so i ve been playing around with some different finishes and really like this one so here it is follow pattern through row 10 7 row 11 ch2 *double_crochet in first stitch single_crochet in next repeat from * around join to beginning ch2 row 12 ch1 *single_crochet in the first stitch double_crochet in the next repeat from * around join to beginning ch1 on this round you are doing a single_crochet in the double_crochet of the previous round and a double_crochet in the previous single_crochet row 13 ch2 half_double_crochet in each stitch around join to beginning ch2 row 14-19 ch2 *fpdc around the first half_double_crochet of the previous round bpdc around the next half_double_crochet of the previous round repeat from * around you should end with a bpdc join to beginning ch2 you can add or subtract as many of these brim row as you like as long as the hat when finished is 7 - 7 ½ long you will have a hat that is sized to fit most average adult heads alternate hat row because double_crochet s all around can get boring see the row my hook is on that s the textural element we are going to add work pattern through row 4 8 row 5 ch2 *double_crochet in first stitch single_crochet in next stitch repeat from * around join to beginning ch2 row 6 ch2 *single_crochet in first stitch double_crochet in next stitch repeat from * around join to beginning ch2 row 7 ch2 double_crochet in each stitch around join to beginning ch2 row 8 ch2 double_crochet in each stitch around join to beginning ch2 row 9-12 repeat row 5-8 one more time row 13 repeat row 5 row 14 repeat row 6 row 15 repeat row 7 now you are at the brim you have a choice to either do the original brim single_crochet in the blo or follow row 14-19 of the alternate ending instructions above adding a nice f&bpdc ​ ​ ribbing note that you will be doing your f&bpdc s around the double_crochet round of row 15 rather than the half_double_crochet row as indicated in the alternate brim instructions above here is what the hat looks like when you do these alternate hat row & alternate ending enjoy your messy bun hat ☮ 9
